metro.TrainManagement.Lines

Class TrainLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • metro.TrainManagement.Lines.TrainLine

  • public class TrainLine
extends java.lang.Object
    A Train line is a collection of several railway connections that touches each other (building one big line). Trains can only move on one of this train lines. To create this line, the TrainLineSelectTool is used to select different nodes, put them into connections and building this line.
    Author:
    hauke

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears this train line, which means that the color of all nodes will be removed.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Check if this train line is a valid line. A line is valid when both of the following conditions apply: 1.) There're more than 2 nodes in this line. 2.) There're exactly 2 end/start nodes in this line. These nodes only have one neighbor.
        Returns:
        True when valid.

      • getColor

        Returns:
